intro: Ischaemum setaceum, commonly known as slender barnyard grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist environments such as wetlands and marshes. The plant has slender, erect stems that are often tinged with red, and its leaves are narrow with a prominent midrib. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet at the tip of each branch, containing small, two-ranked spikelets. Ischaemum setaceum is characterized by its delicate appearance and its ability to thrive in waterlogged soils.
